item.title: Can a fidget spinner spin forever without air drag?
item.description: In this video I test whether a fidget spinner will spin longer in a vacuum chamber than in the air. Once you get them them spinning, fidget spinners spin for a long time. and have very little internal resistance. In order to have a fair comparison between spinning the fidget spinner in air and in the vacuum chamber I had to make sure that they were spinning at the same speed initially. So I did this by blowing air on them to get them to a terminal velocity at that given air pressure. Then I timed how long it would spin from there.

item.title: Glass breaking at 10 million frames per second
item.description: In this video I talk about the actual speed of glass breaking, then I show you how fast glass cracks actually propagate by showing footage from a Shimadzu hypervision HPV-X camera filmed at 10 million frames per second. I talk about how the speed of glass actually varies per glass type and during the glass breaking.

item.title: Can you drink through a hydrophobic straw?
item.description: I check if it is possible to drink with a super hydrophobic straw. I show some weird effects with the straw.

item.title: Bubbles are good at math
item.description: In this video I talk about minimal surfaces and how you can do your own experiment to prove if something is a minimal surface. I talk about why minimal surfaces are important in math and physics and show you some neat experiments to make several minimal surfaces at home

item.title: Why is the sky blue?
item.description: In this video I show you why the sky is blue and the sun is yellow. I talk about Rayleigh and Raman scattering and how it changes the colors that we see from the sun.

item.title: The coolest way to exit a vehicle
item.description: In this video I show you what it looks like to run and jump off a trailer going the same speed as it moving forward. Will you just stand still on the ground? I also show you what it looks like to jump on a moving vehicle. Do you fall off or stay with it?
